B.text: Your strike's energy is poorly aimed.

C.text: Strike's energy soaks into the ground.

D.text: Bright flash and little heat disturb foe.

E.text: Foe avoids blast but feels charged.

A.text: Sparks fly. Foe is illuminated by blast.

B.text: Foe's hair stands on end. Frightening!

C.text: Foe waves off sparks and smoke.

E.text: Foe sees spots. You have initiative.

A.text: Bolt reaches for foe but then grounds out. You have initiative.

B.text: Mild jolt to foe's shoulder causes him to hesitate. You have initiative.

C.text: The thunderous crack of your attack panics foe. You gain the initiative.

D.text: Bolt jumps to foe's weapons and then into the ground. You have initiative.

E.text: Flash unbalances foe and sends him on the defensive. You have initiative.

A.text: Foe flinches from the static in the air. You have the initiative.

B.text: The blast of light and heat daunts foe. He looks away; you have initiative.

C.text: Flying debris obstructs foe's vision. You have 2 rounds of initiative.

D.text: Foe strikes out at the blast to protect himself. It seems to work well enough.

E.text: Foe fails to avoid some of the attack and almost falls down.

A.text: Foe recoils from thundering sound of the blast. He loses 2 rounds initiative.

B.text: Flashes of light and sharp cracks. Foe's impressed.You have 2 rnds initiative.

C.text: Any coins on foe heat up smolder in foe's pockets. He steps back.

D.text: Your attack jolts foe into action. He steps back and swings in all directions.

E.text: Foe is magnetized foe a moment. It distracts him. He is dazed.

A.text: Blast almost misses, but it grounds into foe's weapon arm.

B.text: Foe's side and back are entangled by blast. Foe is shaken.

C.text: Foe heats up and goes on defensive until he cools. His footing is good.

D.text: Entangle foe in deadly blue light. Garments smolder and traces of energy inhabit his equipment.

E.text: Foe's equipment is infested by the blast. Garments are scorched; exposed skin is burned. Foe is a wreck.

A.text: Small bits of electrical energy chase around foe's body. Foe makes a futile effort to throw them off.

B.text: Strike hits foe's chest. Clothes smoke, then burn. Foe flails his arms trying to put them out.

C.text: Strike connects with foe's arm. It careens off each piece of metal foe is wearing. Exposed areas are blistered.

D.text: Direct hit to foe's chest illuminates foe. Much of the strike grounds out. Some of the energy remains for an instant.

E.text: Blast to foe's waist. He stumbles, dazzled by light, and twitches for the next hour. You have 6 rds of initiative.

A.text: Direct sizzling blast to foe's shoulder. It grounds out and leaves foe dazed.

B.text: Back strike throws equipment about. Minor burns to exposed skin.

C.text: Hard strike to side, armor does not help. Blow leaves a permanent mark.

D.text: Blast assaults foe's shield arm. If foe has metal armor he is knocked out.

E.text: Weapon arm endures a terrible onslaught. Foe drops all in his hand.

A.text: Foe is jerked off balance by the strike and has trouble regaining footing.

B.text: Blast heats up metal on foe, causing painful burns to contacting flesh.

C.text: Strong blast hits foe low. His legs almost give from the pain. Foe recoils.

D.text: You hits hard; foe's abdomen is hammered. He steps back 5 feet.

E.text: Bolt passes through foe's leg before grounding. Foe suffers .

A.text: Well placed. Strike slams into foe's weapon arm. Foe's evasion is comical.

B.text: Foe's reflexes are numbed by blast. He is dazed and moving slowly.

C.text: Strike is low and pours into ground. A stray bolt arches into foe's leg.

D.text: Blast to foe's shield shoulder. Foe's shield arm and shield ignite.

E.text: Foe is overcome by the flash. He falls, entangled in his smoldering garments.

A.text: Disrupt the beating of foe's heart for a moment. Reflexes strain muscles. Foe is knocked down.

B.text: Bright flash illumnates foe and jolts every muscle in his body. Foe's reflexes will flinch again in 10 rounds.

C.text: Any metal armor on arm and chest becomes fused together in the blast. Foe's arm is then pinned and useless.

D.text: Foe's neck absorbs the bulk of the attack. Nerves overload. Foe is knocked out and mute for a week.

E.text: Boom! Foe's skeleton crackles with the impact. He drops and dies in 2 rounds.

A.text: Blast climbs up foe's side and sends him stumbling back 5 feet. He blocks his face against a renewed assault.

B.text: Strike lands on shoulder and streaks down back. Foe steps foward in failing attempt to duck. He is vulnerable.

C.text: Back blast. Foe drops to one knee and rises again with some difficulty. Skin is blistered badly.

D.text: The shock of the assault inhabits foe's spine. Muscles and tendons are stretched. He has trouble standing.

E.text: Blasted leaps onto foe's shield arm. His arm and any shield are on fire. Metal is fused.

A.text: Your attack infects foe with electrical energy. It dances all over him. It takes some time for him to recover.

B.text: Chest and arm blast damages organic armor. Metal armor will heat up painfully. Foe smells own hair burning.

C.text: Chest blast. Organic armor is destroyed. Metal armor is scalding hot.

D.text: Attack engulfs foe's weapon. Hand and arm are useless. Skin, muscles, and nerves are damaged.

E.text: Strike savages center of foe's chest. Foe's convulsions resemble a dance. One arm is paralyzed.

A.text: Electrify foe's shield side. Foe finds little protection behind his shield. Hopefully, it contains no metal.

B.text: Abdomen entangled by a great electrical serpent. Foe is knocked down; the beast disappears.

C.text: Nerves in foe's elbow are damaged; shield arm is useless. He drops his weapon on his foot. He is embarassed.

D.text: Blast reaches out with hateful resolve. Foe's neck and back are engulfed. Nerves are damaged and muscles torn.

E.text: Metal on foe fuses to his body, damaging nerves. Dazed, he drops to the ground to look for his marbles.

A.text: Blast goes right into foe's back and he vibrates. He is unaware of much around him for a moment. He flails his weapon around.

B.text: The shock turns foe's reflexes against his muscles. Tendons are torn during foe's violent convulsions. The poor fool.

C.text: Violent shock to foe's abdomen. Armor deflects some of the damage. Foe is terribly unbalanced. Torn cartilage.

D.text: Bolt grapples foe's weapon arm and snakes into his body. His arm is useless. He is dizzy and falls unconscious after 6 active rounds.

E.text: Blast hits shoulder. Foe conducts your strike well. His nervous system is rearranged. He drops and dies of shock and nerve damage in 12 rounds.

A.text: Assault to foe's lower leg fuses metal and burns much. Foe falls. One leg is paralyzed if metal greaves are worn.

B.text: Blast lands on leg with unusual force. Simple leg fracture if he wears armor; a compound fracture if not.

C.text: Brunt of strike infests foe's knee. Muscles and nerves are burned. Foe drops in agony and grips his knee.

D.text: Electrify foe's body. Muscles and tendons tear in convulsions. If no armor he dies in 12 rounds.

E.text: Strike seeks out the shoulder and then his spine. Foe drops, hip and backbone shattered, and dies in 12 rounds.

A.text: Strike arcs up into foe's hip. Garments catch fire. Shock and nerve damage inflicted.

B.text: Jolt blinds foe for 2 days and sends him crashing to the ground. He is badly dazed and helpless while the blindness lasts (2 to 10 days).

C.text: Trapped in a web of light, your foe falls to escape the heat. He is unconsious and, without immediate aid, will go into shock, dying in 12 rounds.

D.text: Strike to foe's head devastates nervous system. He falls into a coma. Foe is a living vegetable. Any metal is hot to the touch.

E.text: Blast rends foe's body, causing fatal damage to organs. His eyes pop out and he dies in 9 inactive rounds. So much for the Govenor's pardon.

A.text: Foe's loses consciousness from the blast. His convulsions keep him standing 1 round.

B.text: Strike overloads foe's nervous system. His heart stops and restarts several times. He drops and dies in 9 rounds.

C.text: Sustained heat of the onslaught fuses metal, cloth, and skin. Foe's eyes pop out of his head. He dies in 3 rounds.

D.text: Foe reels back 10 feet. Nerve damage and shock combined with broken hip and arm spell death in 3 painful rnds.

E.text: Titanic blast virtually cuts foe in half. Bolts streak across ground threatening new victims. Foe is dead, of course.

A.text: Foe's head is ablaze. Garments catch fire. Foe falls unconscious and dies in 6 rounds from nerve damage.

B.text: Foe's insides heat up and burn, destroying nerves and organs alike. Foe drops and dies instantly.

C.text: Strike lands on foe's head. Muscles are fused, tendons torn. Foe's brain fries. He slips to ground and dies in 3 rnds.

D.text: Havoc reigns around foe. Closest thing to him is also entangled in this deadly bolt. He dies 2 rnds later.

E.text: Strike to foe's head. He is burned to a cinder. What is left blows away on the wind. All fear you.
